name: Name
job: Computer Engineer specialized in Information Systems and Software Engineering
about:
Freshly graduated in Computer Engineering Specialized in Information Systems and Software Engineering (SIGL) within the Free University of Tunis, I have always been passionate about the field of computer science because it requires great capacities of analysis, rigor and strong flexibility. Added to this is a certain taste for teamwork. 
 
 Regarding the professional environment, I currently have about 10 months of experience in areas such as: 
 - Software design and development; 
- Agile project management. 
This experience was acquired through the various internships that I have completed and at the end of which my managers have always praised my speed of learning, my ability to adapt and integrate but also my rigor in respecting deadlines. . 
 
 All in all, I would describe myself as someone dynamic and constantly looking for new challenges. These allow me to increase my practical skills while developing my creativity.

experiences.title: Full Stack Web Developer
Web Technician

educations.title: Engineering Degree in Information Systems and Software Engineering
educations.description: Computer engineering, or computer engineering, is a discipline that deals with the design, development, and manufacture of computer systems, both from a hardware and software perspective. At the Free University of Tunis, our curriculum is spread over 6 semesters, three of which are common core, two where each student is required to choose a specialty and the last is dedicated to the end-of-studies internship at the end of which the student get his engineering degree.

educations.title: MPES Preparatory Classes (Mathematics, Physics and Engineering Sciences)
educations.description: The preparatory classes, which last two years, allow new baccalaureate holders to prepare for the three years of the engineering cycle.

projects.title: Xpense
projects.caption: Expense report management web application
projects.description:
FullStack graduation project consisting of the design and implementation of a web application for companies wishing to optimize the management of their employees' expenses and expense reports and reduce the time allocated to it.

Technologies: BackEnd (Node.JS, Express.JS, Firebase, CouchDB) - FrontEnd (Next.JS, REACT) - Project management method (KANBAN)

projects.title: TopTroc
projects.caption: Barter Mobile Application
projects.description:
Academic project consisting in the design and development of a mobileandroid application allowing its users to exchange objects or to help each other 

Technologies: Mobile Application (Android, Firebase, REST Api), Web Administration Interface  (Springboot & Angular).

projects.title: FindLove
projects.caption: Dating web app
projects.description:
FullStack academic project consisting of the design and development of a web application for singles wishing to meet other singles; Meetings that may or may not lead to romantic relationships! 

 Technologies: BackEnd (MongoDB, Express.Js, Node.Js) - FrontEnd (Angular)

projects.title: FastJob
projects.caption: Professional social network
projects.description:
Design and development of a Tunisian professional social network called “Fastjob” intended only for computer scientists. It will allow users to find work, recruit employees, open up new business prospects, or even have an accessible and up-to-date online address book. 

Fastjob must have features such as:
• A registration and authentication system. 
• A messaging system allowing recruiting companies and job seekers to chat in real time to facilitate the recruitment process. 
• A candidate area that will allow users looking for jobs to follow news on new offers and apply. 
• A company space to allow recruiters to manage CVs, monitor and control the entire recruitment process, but also to showcase their company through the presentation of its activities and information, the display of its logo and the listing of its advertisements. 

Technologies used: Spring Boot, Spring Security, Spring Data, MySQL

certifications.title: CCNA 1
certifications.caption: Cisco Certified Network Associate Routing and Switching 1
certifications.description:
The CISCO CCNA Routing and Switching Level 1 training is the starting point for all professionals working in the field of networks. 
It provides the basic knowledge and skills to install, configure and verify IPv4 and IPv6 LANs, and identify basic security threats.
It reviews the architecture, structure and functions needed to support the operations of large companies as well as those of small innovative brands.

certifications.title: CCNA 2
certifications.caption: Cisco Certified Network Associate Routing and Switching 2
certifications.description:
The CISCO CCNA Routing and Switching Level 2 training provides the knowledge and skills necessary to install, configure, and troubleshoot corporate network infrastructures. 
It covers redundant topologies, troubleshooting common network problems, configuring dynamic routing protocols associated with IPv4 and IPv6, managing devices and basic services.

certifications.title: TOEIC
certifications.caption: Test of English for International Communication
certifications.description: The Test of English for International Communication (TOEIC) tests are standardized certifications to assess the level of English of non-English speakers in writing and speaking. These tests, created and managed by an organization based in the United States (the ETS: Educational Testing Service), aim in particular to assess the linguistic knowledge of the candidate in a professional context, without ever entering into a specific technical jargon.

certifications.title: PMP
certifications.caption: Project Management Professional
certifications.description: The PMP1 certification is an international certification in project management. This certification is issued by the Project Management Institute. The objective of this certification is to be able to formally assess the experience, knowledge and performance of project managers around the world and to have their profession recognized as a substantial activity for projects.
